GRPO stands for Group Relative Policy Optimization, a method introduced by Shao et al. (2024) to reduce the training costs of reinforcement learning (RL). Instead of using a critic model of the same size as the policy model, GRPO estimates the baseline using group scores. For each question \( q \), it samples a group of outputs \(\{o_1, o_2, \ldots, o_G\}\) from the old policy \(\pi_{old}\) and optimizes the policy model \(\pi_\theta\) by maximizing the objective. This approach reduces the computational costs associated with maintaining a critic model that is typically the same size as the policy model.
